keyMoments.title: Brook's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Brook is first seen as a skeleton wearing a formal suit with an afro, sitting calmly on his ghost ship drinking tea and singing his iconic 'Yo-ho-ho' laugh.
keyMoments.significance: The debut of what will become the ninth and final member of the Straw Hat Pirates. His appearance as a living skeleton immediately establishes him as one of the most unique characters in the series.

keyMoments.title: Brook's Formal Introduction
keyMoments.description: Brook formally introduces himself to Luffy, Nami, and Sanji, expressing surprise and joy at seeing real people after years of isolation encountering only ghost ships in the Florian Triangle.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Brook's gentleman persona and hints at his tragic backstory of prolonged isolation. Shows his cultured manners despite his skeletal appearance.
keyMoments.quote: You gave me quite a start! I was so surprised to see real people. All I've seen for years were terrifying ghost ships.

keyMoments.title: Brook's Panties Request
keyMoments.description: Despite introducing himself as a gentleman, Brook immediately asks Nami if he may see her panties, earning a kick to the floor. This establishes his controversial running gag.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Brook's signature comedic trait that will define many of his interactions throughout the series, contrasting sharply with his otherwise refined demeanor.

keyMoments.title: Brook Accepts Luffy's Invitation
keyMoments.description: Luffy immediately asks Brook to join the Straw Hat Pirates as their musician. Brook enthusiastically accepts despite having just met them, though his actual joining is delayed until later in the arc.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of Brook's journey to officially become a Straw Hat, fulfilling Luffy's long-standing dream of having a musician on his crew since Episode 1.
